intro: Paraboea longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled paraboea, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with long petioles. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, spherical berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
